intro: Onosma echioides subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf onosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. This subspecies is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, sunny environments.
